data.title: Announcements
data.text:
In lieu of an abstract, here is a brief excerpt of the content:

Announcements Fall Tours Conducted by the Cincinnati Heritage Programs Museum Gems of Cincinnati' s West End Saturday,September 9th from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. Tour the 1804 Betts House, the 1870 John Hauck House and the Cincinnati Fire Museum. Fee: $ 55 members; $ 60 nonmembers includes bus and all entry fees) Registration Deadline: September 1, t Oxford,Ohio Wednesday,October 4th from 9 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Learn how Oxford is connected to President Benjamin Harrison and tour the historic district,the William H. McGuffey Museum and the Zacariah Price Dewitt cabin. Fee: $ 75 members: $ 80 nonmembers includes bus,lunch and all entry fees) Registration Deadline: September 27th Faith of Our Fathers Wednesday,October 18th from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. On this tour will you will see the site of the oldest continuous Qyaker meeting west of the Alleghenies in Waynesville, learn about Shaker life at the Wayne County History Museum,visit the picturesque Swedenborgian Church of the New Jerusalem in Glendale and hear about the famous antislavery debates of the Presbyterian Lane Seminarv. Fee: $ 75 members; $ 80 nonmembers includes bus,lunch and all entry fees) Registration Deadline: October 11th SUMMER 2006 79 ANNOUNCEMENTS APWoe HHI fncline * th St. efnejnnofi. U Inclines and Overlooks Saturday,November 4m from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. Visit the sites of Cincinnati' s five inclines that carried people and freight up from the smoky,crowded basin to hilltops above. Hear the story of Cincinnati s seven hills" and the wonders of nineteeIithcentury transportation enghieering.
